alert.note: Alert for Alamance (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 23 at 4:27PM EDT until May 23 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR CENTRAL ALAMANCE COUNTY... At 427 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. The heaviest rain has moved out of this area, but additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are still possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Burlington, Graham, Mebane, Elon, Gibsonville, Haw River, Swepsonville, Alamance, Glen Raven, Lake Cammack Park & Marina, Lake Burlington, Union Ridge, Altamahaw-Ossipee and Lake Mackintosh Marina. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
